Detailed Description

Main widget in the main window.

This class is the main part of tapi_gui, it's the main widet in embedded in the main windows (Tapi::MainGui). It communicates with the core to get its data and controls the core by sending it messages about connections (new/delete) or about clearing inactive/all devices in the core.

Author
Tobias Holst
Version
4.0.1

std::string  name,
std::string  uuid,
std::map< std::string, Tapi::Feature >  features 
)
private

Add a device to the core, even if the device is not connected. Necessary to be able to load a config file which may include inactive devices.

Parameters
typeType of the eevice (tapi_lib::Device::Type_Publisher for Publisher and ServiceServer or tapi_lib::Device::Type_Subscriber for Subscriber and ServiceClients)
nameName of the device
uuidUnique ID of the device
featuresMap of the device's features

Definition at line 187 of file tapigui.cpp.

void Tapi::TapiGui::checkForGuiUpdate ( )
privateslot

Slot function connected to guitimer. Checks for pending Changes and redraws the gui. First it checks, whether there are changes the core already mentioned or when it didn't "say" anything for a long time. If yes it calls updateData and the data is updated/added to the gui members and the gui is redrawn.

See also
Tapi::TapiGui::guitimer
Tapi::TapiGui::updateData
Tapi::TapiGui::pendingChanges

Definition at line 449 of file tapigui.cpp.

void Tapi::TapiGui::clearAllButtonClicked ( )
privateslot

Slot function connected to the click-event of the clear all button.

It then sends the command to the core that it should delete all of its content and demarkates a pending connection in the gui, since there is no device anymore then.

See also
Tapi::TapiGui::clearAllPub

bool Tapi::TapiGui::compareDeviceNames ( const Tapi::GuiDevice *  first,
const Tapi::GuiDevice *  second 
)
staticprivate

To sort GuiDevices there has to be a compare function, comparing their names.

Parameters
firstPointer to the first GuiDevice to compare
secondPointer to the second GuiDevice to compare
Returns
true if the first GuiDevice's name has to be above the second's GuiDevice name in an alphabetically sort, false when it's vice versa
See also
Tapi::GuiDevice

Definition at line 222 of file tapigui.cpp.

void Tapi::TapiGui::connectFeatures ( std::string  feature1UUID,
std::string  feature2UUID,
double  coefficient = 1.0 
)
private

Send the command to the core that it shall connect two features.

When the user has selected two features of the same type on compatible device types (Subscriber to Publisher or ServiceClient to ServiceServer), this function is called and sends a message to the core with the two uuids which shahll be connected

Parameters
feature1UUIDUnique ID of one of the two features which schall be connected
feature2UUIDUnique ID of the other of the two features which schall be connected
coefficientOptional, if set and it's a compatible tpye (simple number type of std_msgs like UInt32 or Float64) there can be a coefficient and all values have to be multiplied with this value. But has to be implemented on the client side!
See also
Tapi::TapiGui::featureClicked
Tapi::TapiGui::conPub

Parameters

Definition at line 242 of file tapigui.cpp.

void Tapi::TapiGui::featureClicked ( Tapi::GuiDevice *  guidevice,
Tapi::Feature *  feature 
)
privateslot

Slot function connected to the "featureClicked" event of all GuiDevice objects, emitted by their mousReleaseEvent.

When a feature is clicked and this event is called it checks if its the second click to this feature. If yes, the feature is demarcated. Then it checks, if it's the second selection an whether both devices can be connected or not. If yes, the "connectFeatures" function is called. If not, the old selection will be overwritten by the last selected feature. If a feature of a Subscriber or ServiceClient is clicked, which is alreads connected, it asks the user, if the connection shall be deleted (if there is currently no selection) or replaced (if there is currently a selection and the devices are compatible)

Parameters
guideviceA pointer to the guidevice who emitted the signal and "called" this slot
featureA pointer to the feature the user clicked on
See also
Tapi::GuiDevice::featureClicked

Definition at line 249 of file tapigui.cpp.

void Tapi::TapiGui::loadButtonClicked ( )
privateslot

Slot function connected to the click event of the load button.

It opens a file picker to choose a file, deletes every device and connection in the gui and the core and tries to read the file. Its data is then sent to the core

See also
Tapi::TapiGui::addDeviceToTapi
Tapi::TapiGui::clearAllButtonClicked

Definition at line 629 of file tapigui.cpp.

void Tapi::TapiGui::paintEvent ( QPaintEvent *  )
protected

Overrides the paintEvent of Qt to draw the connections between devices in the main widget.

It iterates through all connections, searches for both GuiDevice objects and then it tries to find both Tapi::Feature belonging to the connection. Then it gets their positions of the feature boxes and draws line between them. If there is a current selection pending, it additionally draws a line from the start to the current mouse position.

See also
Tapi::Feature in the tapi_lib package
Tapi::GuiDevice::FeatureBoxPosition

Definition at line 136 of file tapigui.cpp.

void Tapi::TapiGui::saveButtonClicked ( )
privateslot

Slot function connected to the click event of the save button.

It opens a file picker to choose an output file. Then all data of the gui (which should be the same as in the core) is saved into this file

Definition at line 733 of file tapigui.cpp.

void Tapi::TapiGui::timer ( const ros::TimerEvent &  e)
private

"timer" is called by a ros callback when the timer event occurs, it then checks if the gui should do an update of its data from the core, because the core didn't send new data for a too long time

Parameters
eUnused

Parameters

Definition at line 267 of file tapigui.cpp.

void Tapi::TapiGui::updateData ( )
private

Actually update all the data in the gui.

It calls the services of the core to get all data and then compares it with the data already stored in the gui. If there is new data, the data is updated/added.

See also
Tapi::TapiGui::checkForGuiUpdates

bool Tapi::TapiGui::pendingChanges
private

Synchronize gui thread(s) with ros thread whether there are pending changes to be drawn.

No mutex necessary since this is a bool and it's only written in one thread anyways.

See also

Definition at line 246 of file tapigui.hpp.

std::map<std::string, Tapi::GuiDevice*> Tapi::TapiGui::publisherGuiDevices
private

Map of all Publisher/ServiceServer GuiDevices.

Map is filled and updated by the updateData function, which sorts the devices by name and sorts them by type (tapi_lib::Device::Type_Publisher for Publisher and ServiceServer or tapi_lib::Device::Type_Subscriber for Subscriber and ServiceClients)

See also
Device.msg of the tapi_lib package

ros::Timer Tapi::TapiGui::updateTimer
private

This timer is used to regularly check the core for updates, even if there was no call of updateAvailable.

Calls function "timer" on a timer event. Checks every CHECK_INTERVAL milliseconds.

See also
Tapi::TapiGui::timer
